intro: Tragacantha cypria, commonly known as Cyprus tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces a gum resin, which has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a natural adhesive. Tragacantha cypria typically grows in rocky or arid soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
